Detailed Description

Conductors in series described by the relation 1/UTot = 1/U1 + 1/U2.

Computes overall conductance for two conductors in series.

Inverse for U1 becomes singular if U2 == UTot with U1->inf. Inverse for U2 becomes singular if U1 == UTot with U2->inf.

Note:
Generic units so it can be used for either total or per unit area conductance.
Acceptable input set: U1 > 0 U2 > 0 UTot > 0

Units of U1, U2 and UTot must match. E.g., [W/deg_C] or [W/(m^2*deg_C)], ...

Function Documentation

EVALUATE ( sercond__U2   ) 

Series conductors solved for one U2.

Explicit inverse: U2 = (UTot * U1)/(U1 - UTot) When UTot -> 0, U2 -> +0 When U1 -> 0, U2 -> -0

Returns:
U2 = 1.0/(1.0/UTot - 1.0/U1)
Parameters:
UTot 
U1 

EVALUATE ( sercond__U1   ) 

Series conductors solved for one U1.

Explicit inverse: U1 = (UTot * U2)/(U2 - UTot) When UTot -> 0, U1 -> +0 When U2 -> 0, U1 -> -0

Returns:
U1 = 1.0/(1.0/UTot - 1.0/U2)
Parameters:
UTot 
U2 

EVALUATE ( sercond__UTot   ) 

Series conductors solved for UTot.

Returns:
UTot = 1.0/(1.0/U1 + 1.0/U2)
Parameters:
U1 
U2 

Note:
This should never happen since the only way Den==0 is when U1=U2=0. If U1==0 or U2==0, then Num==0 and we never get here!
